metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9992 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the decode_dds1 function in libavcodec/dfa.c in FFmpeg before 2.8.12, 3.0.x before 3.0.8, 3.1.x before 3.1.8, 3.2.x before 3.2.5, and 3.3.x before 3.3.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9992` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec58 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavdevice58 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter7 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavformat-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavformat-extra58 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavformat58 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavutil56 - 7:3.2.6-1
libpostproc55 - 7:3.2.6-1
libswresample3 - 7:3.2.6-1
libswscale5 - 7:3.2.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.2.6-1').
